summary: The document is a classified memo from the CIA to the FBI, dated October 18, 1968, focusing on Libertad ANTIGUA Arrencibia, a suspect Cuban intelligence agent. It details the background and activities of Manuel ABELEND Martin, a former Vice Consul at the Brazilian Embassy in Havana, and his family, including their involvement in clandestine activities and support for anti-CASTRO Cubans. The memo references previous communications between the agencies and underscores the sensitivity and national security importance of the information. It also mentions the dissemination of information to the FBI's Miami representative and hints at Gonzalo ABELEND Martin's role as a sub-source and his assistance to a former CIA asset, utilizing his diplomatic position.
key_findings: Details on Manuel ABELEND Martin and his family's connections to clandestine activities and support for anti-CASTRO Cubans.
References to previous communications (CSCI-316/03970-68 and CSCI-316/03651-68) concerning the subject and related individuals.
Emphasis on the document's sensitivity and its significance to national security during that period.
Insight into Gonzalo ABELEND Martin's potential role as a sub-source and his assistance to a former CIA asset, leveraging his diplomatic status.
